member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbologyOptions
member.summary: Use this class to set preamble, postamble, and global symbology ID options, or to enable multicodes for bar code symbologies. For more information on symbology attributes and how they apply to your Intermec computer, see the Intermec Settings Command Reference Manual.

remarks.para: Any public static (Shared in Visual Basic) members of this type are safe for multi-threaded operations. Instance members are not guaranteed to be thread safe and each instance should be used only within a single thread.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbologyOptions.Multicode
member.summary: An object for set Multicode options.

member.name: M:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbologyOptions.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor that create an instance of the SymbologyOptions class. When you create an instance of the class, you also create an instance of the SymbologyOptions class.
member.param: A handle that passed by BarcodeReader class.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbologyOptions.SymbologyIdentifier
member.summary: Sets and gets the global symbology ID option.
member.remarks: Support for this property depends on the hardware and firmware in your Intermec computer. To determine whether or not your computer supports this option, check the Intermec Settings application on the computer.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class BarcodeReader Private WithEvents bcr As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader
Private Sub BarcodeReader_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try bcr = New Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader() bcr.symbologyOptions.SymbologyIdentifier = SymbologyOptions.ESymbologyIdentifier.UserDefined Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbologyOptions.Preamble
member.summary: Sets or gets the character string (up to 20 characters) that is prepended to scanned data.

remarks.para: For example, if the preamble is set to "Martin," then a data string such as "305481" is returned as "Martin305481".

Support for this property depends on the hardware and firmware in your Intermec computer. To determine whether or not your computer supports this option, check the Intermec Settings application on the computer.

member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class BarcodeReader Private WithEvents bcr As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader
Private Sub BarcodeReader_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try bcr = New Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader() bcr.symbologyOptions.Preamble = "Martin" Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbologyOptions.Postamble
member.summary: Sets or gets the character string (up to 20 characters) that is appended to scanned data.

remarks.para: For example, if the postamble is set to "PartNumber," then a data string such as "305481" is returned as "305481PartNumber."

Support for this property depends on the hardware and firmware in your Intermec computer. To determine whether or not your computer supports this option, check the Intermec Settings application on the computer.

member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class BarcodeReader Private WithEvents bcr As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader
Private Sub BarcodeReader_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try bcr = New Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader() bcr.symbologyOptions.Postamble = "PartNumber" Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbologyOptions.CMulticode
member.summary: Multicode class that sets the multicode options.

remarks.para: Support for symbologies and their attributes depends on the imager/scanner and associated firmware installed in your Intermec computer, and on the current symbology settings as configured by the Intermec Settings application. For more information, see the Intermec Settings Command Reference Manual.
This class is supported only by Intermec area imagers, such as it is not supported on EV12.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbologyOptions.CMulticode.EnableMulticode
member.summary: Sets and gets the multicode status.
member.remarks: Support for this property depends on the hardware and firmware in your Intermec computer. To determine whether or not your computer supports this option, check the Intermec Settings application on the computer.
member.exception: Throws exception when an error has occurred on bar code read methods and properties.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class BarcodeReader Private WithEvents bcr As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader
Private Sub BarcodeReader_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try bcr = New Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader() bcr.SymbologyOptions.Multicode.EnableMulticode = SymbologyOptions.CMulticode.EEnableMulticode.Enable Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbologyOptions.CMulticode.NumberOfBarcodes
member.summary: Sets and gets the number of bar codes in a multicode.
member.remarks: Support for this property depends on the hardware and firmware in your Intermec computer. To determine whether or not your computer supports this option, check the Intermec Settings application on the computer.
member.exception: Throws exception when an error has occurred on bar code read methods and properties.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class BarcodeReader Private WithEvents bcr As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader
Private Sub BarcodeReader_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try bcr = New Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader() bcr.SymbologyOptions.Multicode.NumberOfBarcodes = 2 Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbologyOptions.CMulticode.IncompleteTransmission
member.summary: Sets and gets incomplete transmission status. When enabled, the UDSI for an incomplete multicode is transmitted after a timeout.
member.remarks: Support for this property depends on the hardware and firmware in your Intermec computer. To determine whether or not your computer supports this option, check the Intermec Settings application on the computer.
member.exception: Throws exception when an error has occurred on bar code read methods and properties.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class BarcodeReader Private WithEvents bcr As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader
Private Sub BarcodeReader_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try bcr = New Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader() bcr.SymbologyOptions.Multicode.IncompleteTransmission = SymbologyOptions.CMulticode.EIncompleteTransmission.Enable Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbologyOptions.CMulticode.CodeMark
member.summary: Compose a one character code mark symbology identifier for a complete multicode. The code mark is transmitted as follows:[code mark symbology id] <data>.
member.value: One ASCII character, or one non-printable ASCII character (such as "\x12").
member.remarks: If you set a string of length 0, getting this property returns \x0. The non-printable ASCII character is not displayed with the get property.
member.exception: Throws exception when an error has occurred on bar code read methods and properties.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class BarcodeReader Private WithEvents bcr As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader
Private Sub BarcodeReader_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try bcr = New Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader() bcr.SymbologyOptions.Multicode.CodeMark = "*" Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbologyOptions.CMulticode.IncompleteTransmissionTimeout
member.summary: Sets and gets the incomplete transmission timeout (in ms). When incomplete transmission status is enabled, the incomplete multicode UDSI is sent after this timeout. The timeout starts after the last bar code is read.
member.value: Range is 0 to 65535 ms.
member.remarks: Support for this property depends on the hardware and firmware in your Intermec computer. To determine whether or not your computer supports this option, check the Intermec Settings application on the computer.
member.exception: Throws exception when an error has occurred on bar code read methods and properties.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class BarcodeReader Private WithEvents bcr As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader
Private Sub BarcodeReader_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try bcr = New Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader() bcr.SymbologyOptions.Multicode.IncompleteTransmissionTimeout = 2 Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbologyOptions.CMulticode.CompleteMulticode
member.summary: Sets and gets a user-defined symbology identifier (UDSI, from 0 to 4 characters) for a complete multicode. The UDSI is transmitted as "[UDSI symbology id]<data>".

remarks.para: Support for this property depends on the hardware and firmware in your Intermec computer. To determine whether or not your computer supports this option, check the Intermec Settings application on the computer.
If there are no characters specified for CompleteMulticode, and symbology ID transmission is active, no symbology ID is sent (for this symbology only).

member.exception: Throws exception when an error has occurred on bar code read methods and properties.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class BarcodeReader Private WithEvents bcr As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader
Private Sub BarcodeReader_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try bcr = New Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader() bcr.SymbologyOptions.Multicode.CompleteMulticode = "UDM0" Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

remarks.para: Support for this property depends on the hardware and firmware in your Intermec computer. To determine whether or not your computer supports this option, check the Intermec Settings application on the computer.
If there are no characters specified for IncompleteMulticode, and symbology ID transmission is active, no symbology ID is sent (for this symbology only).

member.exception: Throws exception when an error has occurred on bar code read methods and properties.

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbologyOptions.CMulticode.EEnableMulticode
member.summary: An enum data type for the EnableMulticode property

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbologyOptions.CMulticode.EEnableMulticode.Disable
member.summary: Read and send bar code as normal.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbologyOptions.CMulticode.EEnableMulticode.Enable
member.summary: Check each bar code to see if it is part of a multicode. If not, the bar code is read and sent as normal.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbologyOptions.CMulticode.EEnableMulticode.Exclusive
member.summary: Discard any bar code that is not part of a multicode.

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbologyOptions.CMulticode.EIncompleteTransmission
member.summary: An enum data type for the property.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbologyOptions.CMulticode.EIncompleteTransmission.Disable
member.summary: Disable transmission of an incomplete multicode.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbologyOptions.CMulticode.EIncompleteTransmission.Enable
member.summary: Enable transmission of an incomplete multicode. The incomplete multicode UDSI is transmitted after the timeout expires.

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbologyOptions.CMulticode.CBarcode1
member.summary: Sets length, mask, and symbology type for the first bar code in a multicode symbology.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbologyOptions.CMulticode.CBarcode1.Symbology
member.summary: Sets and gets the symbology type for the first bar code in a multicode symbology.
member.remarks: Bar codes in a multicode symbology are sent in order of bar code ID (bar code 1, bar code 2, and so on). If no bar code ID is used and the multicode function is applied to all bar codes, the bar codes are sent in the order read.
member.exception: Throws exception when an error has occurred on bar code read methods and properties.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class BarcodeReader Private WithEvents bcr As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader
Private Sub BarcodeReader_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try bcr = New Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader() bcr.SymbologyOptions.Multicode.Barcode1.Symbology = SymbologyOptions.SymbologyType.All Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbologyOptions.CMulticode.CBarcode1.Length
member.summary: Sets and gets the length of bar code 1 in a multicode symbology. If any length is acceptable, set this property to 0.
member.value: Range is 0 to 65535.
member.exception: Throws exception when an error has occurred on bar code read methods and properties.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class BarcodeReader Private WithEvents bcr As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader
Private Sub BarcodeReader_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try bcr = New Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader() bcr.SymbologyOptions.Multicode.Barcode1.Symbology = SymbologyOptions.SymbologyType.All bcr.SymbologyOptions.Multicode.Barcode1.Length = 25 Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbologyOptions.CMulticode.CBarcode1.Mask
member.summary: Sets and gets a mask (up to 26 characters) for the first bar code in a multicode symbology.
member.remarks:
The mask is used as a filter to determine which incoming data will be used for first bar code in the multicode symbology. No mask is used if there is no character.
* = zero or more characters
? = one character

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection2.SignatureScenario
member.summary: When you create an instance of the ImagerCapture class, you also create four instances of the SignatureScenario class. Each instance (also called a signature capture scenario and named SignatureScenario1, SignatureScenario2, SignatureScenario3, and SignatureScenario4) can be selected as a property in the ImagerCapture instance.

remarks.para: Each instance (SignatureScenario1, SignatureScenario2, SignatureScenario3, and SignatureScenario4) includes its own properties, such as symbology type, bar code length, or bar code mask, that define the conditions that will automatically trigger a signature capture.

Bar codes that meet the identifier, length, and mask values will trigger the signature capture scenario as specified. If this interferes with other data collection activities, Intermec recommends making your signature capture scenario definitions as specific as possible. Specify a scenario symbology, bar code length, and mask combination that is unlikely to occur in another bar code to avoid interference with regular decoding.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.SignatureScenario.ScenarioContrastEnhancement
member.summary: Enables scenario contrast enhancement (also known as dynamic stretching) of the capture image. This property uses the property of the ImageConditioning class.
member.exception: Throws an exception on incorrect input value errors.
Throws an exception on get and set errors.
throws exception if failed on sets or gets imager capture value.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class Form1 Private WithEvents imgCapture As Intermec.DataCollection2.ImagerCapture
Private Sub Form1_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load imgCapture = New ImagerCapture() imgCapture.SignatureScenario1.ScenarioContrastEnhancement = ImageConditioning.ContrastEnhancementValue.Photo End Sub End Class

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.SignatureScenario.ScenarioTextEnhancement
member.summary: Enables scenario text enhancement, which controls the readability of text in the image, using the property of the ImageConditioning class.
member.exception: Throws an exception on incorrect input value errors.

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader
member.summary:
The BarcodeReader class allows you to control the internal, external bar code scanners, or Camera if support on a deivce.
Use the field in a BarcodeReader object to get and set decoding options for supported symbologies. Symbology is set if port state is either enabled or disabled when set option is requested.
Use the field in a BarcodeReader object to get and set postamble and preamble text, to set global symbology ID information, or to configure reading multicode symbologies of up to 8 separate bar codes. Symbology option is set if port state is either enabled or disabled when set option is requested.
Use the field in the method of a BarcodeReader object to get all ports information of devcie.
Method and/or property set request will performed if a scanner port state is either enabled or disabled when request is made.

remarks.para: Any public static (Shared in Visual Basic) members of this type are safe for multi-threaded operations. Instance members are not guaranteed to be thread safe and each instance should be used only within a single thread.

Support for some BarcodeReader functions depends on the hardware options and on the firmware versions installed on your Intermec computer and its peripherals, such as external scanners. For more information on compatibility, see the user manual for your Intermec product.

member.summary: An object of class that sets and gets symbology settings through the BarcodeReader class.

member.summary: An object of the class that sets and gets symbology options settings through the BarcodeReader class.

Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub
Private Sub bcr_BarcodeRead(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal bre As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReadEventArgs) Handles bcr.BarcodeRead ListBox1.Items.Add("strBarcodeData = " + bre.strBarcodeData) ListBox1.Items.Add("SymbologyId = " + bre.SymbologyId.ToString()) ListBox1.Items.Add("SymbologyName = " + bre.SymbologyName) ListBox1.Items.Add("DataType = " + bre.DataType) ListBox1.Items.Add("BytesInBuffer = " + bre.BytesInBuffer) ListBox1.Items.Add("PortID = " + bre.PortID.ToString()) ListBox1.Items.Add("PortName = " + bre.PortName) ListBox1.Items.Add("PortDeviceType = " + bre.PortDeviceType) End Sub End Class

member.name: M:Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Overloaded constructor sets the scanner name and uses the default buffer (2 KB).
member.param: Name of the scanner to be used.

remarks.para: Multiple simultaneous instances of this class are NOT supported. Before you create a new instance, use to dispose of the existing instance.

The BarcodeReader class supports the following device names:
To use the internal scanner for your Intermec computer, set deviceName to "Internal".
For external scanners connected to your Intermec computer, set deviceName to "External".
For Camera, set deviceName to "Camera". It is supported on 70 Series currently.
For All scanners (exclude Camera), set deviceName to "All".
If Camera is the barcode scan source, use the for using the Camera. To preview barcode with Camera, set the to true.

member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class BarcodeReader Private WithEvents bcr As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader
Private Sub BarcodeReader_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try bcr = New Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader("Internal") bcr.PostRead = True
Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub
Private Sub bcr_BarcodeRead(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal bre As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReadEventArgs) Handles bcr.BarcodeRead ListBox1.Items.Add("strBarcodeData = " + bre.strBarcodeData) ListBox1.Items.Add("SymbologyId = " + bre.SymbologyId.ToString()) ListBox1.Items.Add("SymbologyName = " + bre.SymbologyName) ListBox1.Items.Add("DataType = " + bre.DataType) ListBox1.Items.Add("BytesInBuffer = " + bre.BytesInBuffer) ListBox1.Items.Add("PortID = " + bre.PortID.ToString()) ListBox1.Items.Add("PortName = " + bre.PortName) ListBox1.Items.Add("PortDeviceType = " + bre.PortDeviceType) End Sub End Class

member.name: M:Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader.#ctor(System.String,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Overloaded constructor sets the scanner name and sets the buffer size.
member.param: Name of the scanner to be used.

Size in bytes of the buffer (minimum 130 bytes). Although the default size of 2 KB is adequate for most applications, if you are using a bar code symbology that encodes a larger amount of data, you should specify a larger buffer size

remarks.para: Multiple simultaneous instances of this class are NOT supported. Before you create a new instance, use to dispose of the existing instance.

The BarcodeReader class supports the following device names:
To use the internal scanner for your Intermec computer, set deviceName to "Internal".
For external scanners connected to your Intermec computer, set deviceName to "External".
For Camera, set deviceName to "Camera". It is supported on 70 Series currently.
For All scanners (exclude Camera), set deviceName to "All".
If Camera is the barcode scan source, use the for using the Camera. To preview barcode with Camera, set the to true.

member.summary: Overloaded constructor uses a specified scanner and sets the buffer size. Use this constructor for applications without a user interface.
member.param: Set to null for a formless application.
Name of the scanner to be used.

Size in bytes for the buffer (minimum 130 bytes). Although the default size of 2 KB is adequate for most applications, if you are using a bar code symbology that encodes a larger amount of data, you should specify a larger buffer size.

remarks.para: Even if your application does not use a form, you need to add a reference to System.Windows.Forms.
Multiple simultaneous instances of this class are NOT supported. Before you create a new instance, use to dispose of the existing instance.

member.name: M:Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources from the scanner. Your application must call Dispose before exiting, or the application may not exit properly.
member.remarks: Multiple simultaneous instances of this class is not supported. Before you create a new instance, use this method to dispose of the existing instance.

example.code:

Private Sub MenuItem1_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MenuItem1.Click If bcr Is Nothing Then 'do nothing Else bcr.Dispose() End If
Application.Exit() End Sub End Class

member.name: M:Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader.SetViewFinderCoordinates(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the screen coordinates for the viewfinder.
member.param: The x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the screen rectangle. Default value is 0.
The y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the screen rectangle. Default value is 0.
The x-coordinate of the lower-right corner of the screen rectangle. For a VGA display in portrait orientation, the maximum value of RightPosition is 480. Default value is 480.
The y-coordinate of the lower-right corner of the screen rectangle. For a VGA display in portrait orientation, the maximum value of BottomPosition is 640. Default value is 640.

remarks.para: This method only supports the Camera is used in .
Although you can specify the viewfinder size, the size of the image in the viewfinder depends on the image aspect ratio (width/height) of the camera in the computer. The default aspect ratio is .75.
The image is always scaled to maintain that aspect ratio. If you specify a viewfinder size with a different aspect ratio, the image does not fill the viewfinder rectangle.
When the display is in Portrait mode, the image will fill the viewfinder if the viewfinder size is set to 0, 0, 480, 640.

Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class BarcodeReader Private WithEvents bcr As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader
Private Sub BarcodeReader_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try bcr = new Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader("Camera") bcr.SetButtonAction(BarcodeReader.ButtonID.Center, BarcodeReader.ButtonActionType.Camera) bcr.SetViewFinderCoordinates(0, 0, 480, 350) bcr.ViewFinderEnable = true bcr.PostRead = true Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub
Private Sub bcr_BarcodeRead(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal bre As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReadEventArgs) Handles bcr.BarcodeRead ListBox1.Items.Add("strBarcodeData = " + bre.strBarcodeData) ListBox1.Items.Add("SymbologyId = " + bre.SymbologyId) ListBox1.Items.Add("SymbologyName = " + bre.SymbologyName) ListBox1.Items.Add("DataType = " + bre.DataType) ListBox1.Items.Add("BytesInBuffer = " + bre.BytesInBuffer) ListBox1.Items.Add("PortId = " + bre.PortId) ListBox1.Items.Add("PortName = " + bre.PortName) ListBox1.Items.Add("PortDeviceType = " + bre.PortDeviceType) End Sub End Class

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader.PortInfo
member.summary: Struct for storing ports information in .

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class BarcodeReader Private WithEvents bcr As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader
Private Sub BarcodeReader_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try bcr = New BarcodeReader()
bcr.GetPortInfo(bcr.portInfoArray)
For Each myPort As BarcodeReader.PortInfo In bcr.portInfoArray ListBox1.Items.Add("portId = " + myPort.PortId.ToString()) ListBox1.Items.Add("DeviceType = " + myPort.PortDeviceType) ListBox1.Items.Add("PortName = " + myPort.PortName) ListBox1.Items.Add("StateID = " + myPort.PortStateID.ToString()) ListBox1.Items.Add("PortState = " + myPort.strPortState) Next Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology
member.summary: Use Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology to set decoding and attribute options for bar code symbologies.

remarks.para: Support for symbologies and their attributes depends on the imager/scanner and associated firmware installed in your Intermec computer, and on the current symbology settings as configured by the Intermec Settings application. For more information, see the Intermec Settings Command Reference Manual.

Any public static (Shared in Visual Basic) members of this type are safe for multi-threaded operations. Instance members are not guaranteed to be thread safe and each instance should be used only within a single thread.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CPostnet.UserDefinedSymbologyId
member.summary: String specifying a user-defined symbology ID if not using the AIM standard. The UDSI is transmitted in the format [UDSI]lt;data>.
member.remarks: String is 0 to 4 ASCII characters long. Default user-defined symbology ID is P0. If there is no value specified, and symbology ID transmission is active, no symbology ID is sent for this symbology only.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CAustralianPost.UserDefinedSymbologyId
member.summary: String specifying a user-defined symbology ID if not using the AIM standard. The UDSI is transmitted in the format [UDSI]<data>.
member.remarks: String is 0 to 4 ASCII characters long. Default user-defined symbology ID is P3. If there is no value specified, and symbology ID transmission is active, no symbology ID is sent for this symbology only.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CKOREANPOST.LengthMode
member.summary: Specifies acceptable bar code length. Length1, length2, and length3 are used differently depending on this property.

remarks.para: Minimum length for Code 39 bar codes is 3 characters.
Bar code length = <start> + <bar code data> + <check digit> + <stop>.
When length1, length2, length3, and length mode are set to 0, no length is specified and any length of characters is accepted.

member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CKOREANPOST.Length1
member.summary: Integer value specifying bar code length1. Range is 0 to 255.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CKOREANPOST.Length2
member.summary: Integer value specifying bar code length2. Range is 0 to 255.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CKOREANPOST.Length3
member.summary: Integer value specifying bar code length3. Range is 0 to 255.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

member.remarks: String is 0 to 4 ASCII characters long. Default user-defined symbology ID is B1. If there is no value specified, and symbology ID transmission is active, no symbology ID is sent for this symbology only.

member.summary: Defines attributes for decoding the Codabar symbology.
member.remarks: Support for symbologies and their attributes depends on the imager/scanner and associated firmware installed in your Intermec computer, and on the current symbology settings as configured by the Intermec Settings application. For more information, see the Intermec Settings Command Reference Manual.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CCodabar.CodeMark
member.summary: Compose one ASCII character code mark symbology identifier for Codabar. The code mark is transmitted as <code mark symbology ID><data>.
member.value: One ASCII character, or one non-printable ASCII character (such as "\x12").
member.remarks: If you set a string of length 0, getting this property returns \x0. The non-printable ASCII character is not displayed with the get property.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CCodabar.LengthMode
member.summary: Specifies acceptable bar code length. Length1, length2, and length3 are used differently depending on this property.

remarks.para: Minimum length for Codabar is 3 characters.
Bar code length = <start> + <bar code data> + [check digit] + <stop>.
When length1, length2, length3, and length mode are set to 0, no length is specified and any length of characters is accepted.

member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CCodabar.ClsiLibrarySystem

summary.para: The CLSI library system for Codabar inserts spaces after characters 1, 5, and 10 in the 14-character label. Start/stop characters can be transmitted or not transmitted as required. This system is used by some libraries in the USA.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CCodabar.Concatenation
member.summary: Enables concatenation. Two adjacent Codabar bar codes scanned in a single sweep can be concatenated and sent as a single message. You can also choose to transmit only concatenated data, or all data.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CCodabar.UserDefinedSymbologyId
member.summary: String specifying a user-defined symbology ID if not using the AIM standard. The UDSI is transmitted in the format [UDSI]<data>.
member.remarks: String is 0 to 4 ASCII characters long. Default user-defined symbology ID is B7. If there is no value specified, and symbology ID transmission is active, no symbology ID is sent for this symbology only.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

member.summary: An enum data type for the lengthMode property.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CCodabar.ELengthMode.Length1Minimum
member.summary: Codes with as many characters as specified by length1 and longer are read. Length2 and length3 are not used.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CCodabar.ELengthMode.Lengths123Fixed
member.summary: Only codes that comply with the lengths specified by length1, length2 and length3 will be read.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CCodabar.ELengthMode.Length1MinimumAndLength2Maximum
member.summary: Codes that are at least the minimum length specified by length1 and not longer than the maximum length specified by length2 are read. Length3 is not used.

member.remarks: Use Extended reading range when long-distance bar code reading is important for an application, as read distances are significantly increased.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class BarcodeReader Private WithEvents bcr As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader
Private Sub BarcodeReader_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try bcr = New Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader() bcr.Symbology.Code39.ReadingRange = CSymbology.CCode39.EReadingRange.Normal Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CCode39.UnconventionalCode39

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CCode39.LengthMode
member.summary: Specifies acceptable bar code length. Length1, length2, and length3 are used differently depending on this property.

remarks.para: Minimum length for Code 39 bar codes is 3 characters.
Bar code length = <start> + <bar code data> + <check digit> + <stop>.
When length1, length2, length3, and length mode are set to 0, no length is specified and any length of characters is accepted.

member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class BarcodeReader Private WithEvents bcr As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader
Private Sub BarcodeReader_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try bcr = New Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader() bcr.Symbology.Code39.LengthMode = CSymbology.CCode39.ELengthMode.Length1Minimum Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CCode39.UserDefinedSymbologyId
member.summary: String specifying a user-defined symbology ID if not using the AIM standard. The UDSI is transmitted in the format [UDSI]<data>.
member.remarks: String is 0 to 4 ASCII characters long. Default user-defined symbology ID is B1. If there is no value specified, and symbology ID transmission is active, no symbology ID is sent for this symbology only.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class BarcodeReader Private WithEvents bcr As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader
Private Sub BarcodeReader_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try bcr = New Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader() bcr.Symbology.Code39.UserDefinedSymbologyId = "B1" Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CCode39.CodeMark
member.summary: Set a one-character code mark symbology identifier for Code 39. The code mark is transmitted as <code mark symbology ID><data>.
member.value: One ASCII character, or one non-printable ASCII character (such as "\x12").
member.remarks: If you set a string of length 0, getting this property returns \x0. The non-printable ASCII character is not displayed with the get property.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

member.summary: Disable Code 39 check digit verification.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CCode39.EVerifyCheckDigit.Modulo43
member.summary: Standard check digit for Code 39 using the Modulo 43 algorithm, providing extra validation of data.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CCode39.EVerifyCheckDigit.FrenchCip
member.summary: Check digit used by French pharmaceutical industry. Used only for codes with 7 characters.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CCode39.EVerifyCheckDigit.ItalianCpi
member.summary: Check digit used by Italian pharmaceutical industry, also known as Code 32. If the checksum is not validated, the bar code is transmitted as standard Code 39.

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CCode128
member.summary: Defines attributes for decoding the Code 128 symbology.
member.remarks: Support for symbologies and their attributes depends on the imager/scanner and associated firmware installed in your Intermec computer, and on the current symbology settings as configured by the Intermec Settings application. For more information, see the Intermec Settings Command Reference Manual.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CCode128.CheckDigitVerify
member.summary: Enables French CIP check digit verification, used in the French pharmaceutical industry.

remarks.para: If French CIP check digit is active, decoding only succeeds if barcode length is 14 characters, start is C type, and CIP check digit is verified.
French CIP verification does not force a minimum length of 14 characters.

member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CCode128.Length1
member.summary: Integer value specifying bar code length1. Range is 0 to 255.

remarks.para: When length1, length2, length3, and length mode are set to 0, no length is specified and any bar code length is accepted.
Minimum length for Code 128 or GS1-128 is 1 character. Bar code length = <bar code data>.

member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CCode128.Fnc1Conversion

summary.para: One ASCII character (or a string in hex notation) specifying the Code 128/GS1-128/ISBT FNC1 separator character.
Applies only to FNC1 in first or second position (converted FNC1 character not transmitted).

member.remarks: This separator is used when multiple identifiers and their fields are concatenated. This is useful for keyboard wedge interfaces where the <GS> character cannot be transmitted.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class BarcodeReader Private WithEvents bcr As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader
Private Sub BarcodeReader_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try bcr = New Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader() bcr.Symbology.Code128.Fnc1Conversion = "," Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CCode128.GtinCompliant
member.summary: Enables GTIN processing for GS1-128.
member.remarks: Only GS1-128 bar codes of at least 16 characters that begin with "01" are processed. Non-compliant GS1-128 bar codes are not read when GTIN processing is enabled.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class BarcodeReader Private WithEvents bcr As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader
Private Sub BarcodeReader_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try bcr = New Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader() bcr.Symbology.Code128.GtinCompliant = CSymbology.CCode128.EGtinCompliant.Enable Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CCode128.Code128UserDefinedSymbologyId
member.summary: String specifying a user-defined symbology ID if not using the AIM standard. The UDSI is transmitted in the format [UDSI]<data>.
member.remarks: String is 0 to 4 ASCII characters long. If there is no value specified, and symbology ID transmission is active, no symbology ID is sent for this symbology only.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class BarcodeReader Private WithEvents bcr As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader
Private Sub BarcodeReader_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try bcr = New Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader() bcr.Symbology.Code128.Code128UserDefinedSymbologyId = "B7" Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CCode128.Gs1With128UserDefinedSymbologyId
member.summary: String specifying a user-defined symbology ID if not using the AIM standard. The UDSI is transmitted in the format [UDSI]<data>.
member.remarks: String is 0 to 4 ASCII characters long. Default user-defined symbology ID is C9. If there is no value specified, and symbology ID transmission is active, no symbology ID is sent for this symbology only.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

member.summary: Sets high reading tolerance. Most permissive - reads codes of varying quality.

member.summary: Sets medium reading tolerance.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CCode128.ELengthMode.Length1Minimum
member.summary: Codes with as many characters as specified by Length1 and longer are read. Length2 and Length3 are not used

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CCode128.ELengthMode.Lengths123Fixed
member.summary: Only codes that comply with the lengths specified by Length1, Length2 and Length3 will be read.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CCode128.ELengthMode.Length1MinimumAndLength2Maximum
member.summary: Codes that are at least the minimum length specified by Length1 and not longer than the maximum length specified by Length2 are read. Length3 is not used.

member.summary: An enum data type for the property

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CCode128.EIsbt128ConcatTrans.Disable
member.summary: Codes are always transmitted as single codes (no concatenation).

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CCode128.EIsbt128ConcatTrans.ConcatenatedCodes
member.summary: Only transmits concatenated codes, does not transmit single codes.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CCode128.EIsbt128ConcatTrans.ConcatOrSingleCodes
member.summary: Single codes and concatenated codes are both transmitted. If the product can only "see" one code of a code pair it will send that code as a single code. If the product "sees" both codes of a pair it will concatenate the codes depending on the concatenation mode setting.

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CInterleaved2Of5
member.summary: Defines attributes for decoding the Interleaved 2 of 5 symbology.
member.remarks: Support for symbologies and their attributes depends on the imager/scanner and associated firmware installed in your Intermec computer, and on the current symbology settings as configured by the Intermec Settings application. For more information, see the Intermec Settings Command Reference Manual.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CInterleaved2Of5.Enable
member.summary: Enables decoding of Interleaved 2 of 5.
member.remarks: Enabling this symbology does not ensure decoding is possible for all bar codes read. Some options (such as length or check digit) may prevent decodes.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class BarcodeReader Private WithEvents bcr As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader
Private Sub BarcodeReader_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try bcr = New Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader() bcr.Symbology.Interleaved2Of5.Enable = CSymbology.CInterleaved2Of5.EEnable.Enable Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CInterleaved2Of5.ReadingRange
member.summary: Sets and gets the reading range.

remarks.para: Use Extended reading range when long-distance bar code reading is important for an application, as read distances are significantly increased.
Support on 70 series(EV12, EA30, SR Tethered, Camera), CN50(EA11, EA21), and CS40(EA11).

member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class BarcodeReader Private WithEvents bcr As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader
Private Sub BarcodeReader_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try bcr = New Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader() bcr.Symbology.Interleaved2Of5.ReadingRange = CSymbology.CInterleaved2Of5.EReadingRange.Normal Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CInterleaved2Of5.CodeMark
member.summary: Set a one-character code mark symbology identifier for Interleaved 2 of 5. The code mark is transmitted as <code mark symbology ID><data>.
member.value: One ASCII character, or one non-printable ASCII character (such as "\x12").
member.remarks: If you set a string of length 0, getting this property returns \x0. The non-printable ASCII character is not displayed with the get property.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CInterleaved2Of5.LengthMode
member.summary: Specifies acceptable bar code length.

remarks.para: Minimum length for Interleaved 2 of 5 bar codes is 4 characters.
Bar code length = <bar code data> + [check digit].
When length1, length2, length3, and length mode are set to 0, no length is specified and any length of characters is accepted.

member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CMatrix2Of5.LengthMode
member.summary: Specifies the length mode type.

remarks.para: Use length1, length2, and length3 to compose acceptable bar codes depending on the length mode used. Minimum length for Matrix 2 of 5 bar codes is 3 characters.
Bar code length = <bar code data>.
When length1, length2, length3, and length mode are set to 0, no length is specified and any length of characters is accepted.

member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CMatrix2Of5.UserDefinedSymbologyId
member.summary: String specifying a user-defined symbology ID if not using the AIM standard. The UDSI is transmitted in the format [UDSI]<data>.
member.remarks: String is 0 to 4 ASCII characters long. Default user-defined symbology ID is B4. If no value is specified and symbology ID transmission is active, no symbology ID is sent for this symbology only.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

member.summary: An enum data type for the property.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CMatrix2Of5.ELengthMode.Length1Minimum
member.summary: Codes with as many characters as specified by length1 and longer are read. Length2 and length3 are not used.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CMatrix2Of5.ELengthMode.Lengths123Fixed
member.summary: Only codes that comply with the lengths specified by length1, length2 and length3 will be read.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CMatrix2Of5.ELengthMode.Length1MinimumAndLength2Maximum
member.summary: Codes that are at least the minimum length specified by length1 and not longer than the maximum length specified by length2 are read. Length3 is not used.

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CMsi
member.summary: Defines attributes for decoding the MSI symbology.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CMsi.Enable
member.summary: Enables decoding of MSI.
member.remarks: Enabling this symbology does not ensure decoding is possible for all bar codes read. Some options (such as length or check digit) may prevent decodes.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CStandard2Of5.LengthMode
member.summary: Specifies acceptable bar code length. Length2 and length3 are used differently depending on this property.

remarks.para: Minimum length for Code 2 of 5 bar codes is 3 characters.
Bar code length = <bar code data> + [check digit].
When length1, length2, length3, and length mode are set to 0, no length is specified and any length of characters is accepted.

member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CStandard2Of5.UserDefinedSymbologyId
member.summary: String specifying a user-defined symbology ID if not using the AIM standard. The UDSI is transmitted in the format [UDSI]<data>.
member.remarks: String is 0 to 4 ASCII characters long. Default user-defined symbology ID is B5. If no value is specified and symbology ID transmission is active, then no symbology ID is sent for this symbology only.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

remarks.para: Use length1, length2, and length3 to compose acceptable bar codes depending on the length mode used. Minimum length for Telepen bar codes is 3 characters.
Bar code length = <bar code data> + <check digit>.
When length1, length2, length3, and length mode are set to 0, no length is specified and any length of characters is accepted.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CTelepen.Format
member.summary: Specifies ASCII or Numeric as the format type for Telepen.
member.remarks: When Numeric format is selected, the start/stop and check digits remain unchanged (as with ASCII character values from 0 to 16). Characters from 17 to 26 are changed to the values from 0X to 9X. Values greater than 26 are obtained by subtracting 27 from their ASCII values.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CEanUpc.EnableUpca
member.summary: Enables decoding of UPC-A.

remarks.para: Set to true to enable UPC-A decoding, or set to false to disable decoding.
Enabling UPC-A decoding does not ensure that decoding is possible for all bar codes read. Some options, such as Add-On requirements, may prevent decoding.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CEanUpc.IsbnConversionForEan13

summary.para: Enables ISBN conversion for EAN-13. If enabled, no add-on is transmitted even if required.

ISBN conversion converts all EAN-13 bar codes that begin with "978" or "979" (except for "9790") by removing the first three digits, calculating the checksum on the remaining characters, and adding the ISBN (International Standard Book Number) check digit.

member.remarks: If is enabled, no ISBN conversion occurs.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class BarcodeReader Private WithEvents bcr As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader
Private Sub BarcodeReader_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try bcr = New Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader() bcr.Symbology.EanUpc.IsbnConversionForEan13 = CSymbology.CEanUpc.EIsbnConversionForEan13.Enable Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CEanUpc.AddOnSecurity

summary.para: Sets and gets the security level for decoding.
Security is used only when add-on digits are not required but transmitted. The higher this value, the more secure the decoding, but this can also slow the decode rate.

member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class BarcodeReader Private WithEvents bcr As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader
Private Sub BarcodeReader_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try bcr = New Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader() bcr.Symbology.EanUpc.AddOnSecurity = 50 Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CEanUpc.UpcaCodeMark
member.summary: Set a one-character code mark symbology identifier for UPC-A. The code mark is transmitted as <code mark symbology ID><data>.
member.value: One ASCII character, or one non-printable ASCII character (such as "\x12").
member.remarks: If you set a string of length 0, getting this property returns \x0. The non-printable ASCII character is not displayed with the get property.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CEanUpc.IsmnConversionForEan13
member.summary: Enables ISMN conversion for EAN-13 bar codes. If enabled, ISMN conversion converts EAN-13 bar codes that begin with "9790" by removing the first three digits and replacing the "0" with "M", creating an International Standard Music Number.
member.remarks: If is enabled, no ISMN conversion occurs.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

example.code:

Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CEanUpc.IssnConversionForEan13
member.summary: Enables ISSN conversion of EAN-13 bar codes. If enabled, ISSN conversion converts all EAN-13 bar codes that begin with "977" by removing the first three digits and adding the ISBN check digit. This creates the International Standard Serial Number
member.remarks: If is enabled, no ISSN conversion occurs.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CEanUpc.UpcaUserDefinedSymbologyId
member.summary: A string (0 to 4 characters) that specifies a user-defined symbology ID (UDSI) when not using the AIM standard for this symbology. The UDSI is transmitted in the format [UDSI]<data>.
member.remarks: The default UDSI is A0. If no value is specified and symbology ID transmission is active, no symbology ID is sent for this symbology only.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

example.code:

Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CMicroPdf417
member.summary: Defines attributes for decoding the MicroPdf417 symbology.

remarks.para: Support for symbologies and their attributes depends on the imager/scanner and associated firmware installed in your Intermec computer, and on the current symbology settings as configured by the Intermec Settings application. For more information, see the Intermec Settings Command Reference Manual.
This class is supported only by Intermec area imagers, such as it is not supported on EV12.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CMicroPdf417.EnableMicroPdf417
member.summary: Enables decoding of MicroPDF417.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class BarcodeReader Private WithEvents bcr As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader
Private Sub BarcodeReader_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try bcr = New Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader() bcr.Symbology.MicroPdf417.EnableMicroPdf417 = CSymbology.CMicroPdf417.EEnableMicroPDF417.Enable Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CMicroPdf417.Code128Emulation
member.summary: Enables MicroPDF417 Code 128 emulation, which constrains the MicroPDF character set to the EAN128 character set. Transmission is identical to EAN128 (that is, ]C1xxx).
member.remarks: If the option is enabled, and EAN128Identifier is enabled, the MicroPDF AIM identifier is set to ]C1. If the option is enabled, and EAN128Identifier is disabled, AIM identifier is set to ]L3.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class BarcodeReader Private WithEvents bcr As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader
Private Sub BarcodeReader_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try bcr = New Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader() bcr.Symbology.MicroPdf417.Code128Emulation = CSymbology.CMicroPdf417.ECode128Emulation.Enable Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CMicroPdf417.CodeMark
member.summary: Set a one-character code mark symbology identifier. The code mark is transmitted as <code mark symbology ID><data>.
member.value: One ASCII character, or one non-printable ASCII character (such as "\x12").
member.remarks: If you set a string of length 0, getting this property returns \x0. The non-printable ASCII character is not displayed with the get property.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class BarcodeReader Private WithEvents bcr As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader
Private Sub BarcodeReader_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try bcr = New Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader() bcr.Symbology.MicroPdf417.CodeMark = "*" Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CMicroPdf417.UserDefinedSymbologyId
member.summary: String specifying a user-defined symbology ID if not using the AIM standard. The UDSI is transmitted in the format [UDSI]<data>.
member.remarks: String is 0 to 4 ASCII characters long. Default user-defined symbology ID is C8. If there is no value specified, and symbology ID transmission is active, no symbology ID is sent for this symbology only.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class BarcodeReader Private WithEvents bcr As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader
Private Sub BarcodeReader_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try bcr = New Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader() bcr.Symbology.MicroPdf417.UserDefinedSymbologyId = "C8" Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CPdf417
member.summary: Defines attributes for decoding the PDF417 symbology.

remarks.para: Support for symbologies and their attributes depends on the imager/scanner and associated firmware installed in your Intermec computer, and on the current symbology settings as configured by the Intermec Settings application. For more information, see the Intermec Settings Command Reference Manual.
This class is supported only by Intermec area imagers, such as it is not supported on EV12.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CPdf417.EnablePdf417
member.summary: Enables decoding of PDF417.
member.remarks: Enabling this symbology does not ensure decoding of all bar codes read. Some options (such as length) will prevent decodes.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class BarcodeReader Private WithEvents bcr As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader
Private Sub BarcodeReader_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try bcr = New Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader() bcr.Symbology.Pdf417.EnablePdf417 = CSymbology.CPdf417.EEnablePdf417.Enable Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CPdf417.MacroPdfBuffered
member.summary: Enables MacroPDF buffering. When enabled, multi-labeled PDF417 messages are stored in the scanner buffer until the whole message has been read. Once the whole message has been read the message is transmitted. Bar codes can be read in any order.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class BarcodeReader Private WithEvents bcr As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader
Private Sub BarcodeReader_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try bcr = New Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader() bcr.Symbology.Pdf417.MacroPdfBuffered = CSymbology.CPdf417.EMacroPdfBuffered.Enable Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CPdf417.PdfWithDataLengthId0
member.summary: Enables Irregular PDF. When enabled, PDF417 labels with the symbology length descriptor set to 0 can still be read.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

example.code:

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CCodablockA.UserDefinedSymbologyId
member.summary: String specifying a user-defined symbology ID if not using the AIM standard. The UDSI is transmitted in the format [UDSI]<data>.
member.remarks: String is 0 to 4 ASCII characters long. Default user-defined symbology ID is K0. If there is no value specified, and symbology ID transmission is active, no symbology ID is sent for this symbology only.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CCodablockF
member.summary: Defines attributes for decoding the Codablock F symbology.

remarks.para: Support for symbologies and their attributes depends on the imager/scanner and associated firmware installed in your Intermec computer, and on the current symbology settings as configured by the Intermec Settings application. For more information, see the Intermec Settings Command Reference Manual.
This class is supported only by Intermec area imagers, such as it is not supported on EV12.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CCodablockF.Enable

summary.para: Codablock F is based on Code 128. To avoid confusion, Intermec recommends disabling Code 128 when enabling Codablock F.

member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class BarcodeReader Private WithEvents bcr As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader
Private Sub BarcodeReader_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try bcr = New Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader() bcr.Symbology.CodablockF.Enable = CSymbology.CCodablockF.EEnable.Enable Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CCodablockF.CodeMark
member.summary: Compose a one-character code mark symbology identifier for Codablock F. The code mark is transmitted as <code mark symbology ID><data>.
member.value: One ASCII character, or one non-printable ASCII character (such as "\x12").
member.remarks: If you set a string of length 0, getting this property returns \x0. The non-printable ASCII character is not displayed with the get property.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CTlc39
member.summary: Defines attributes for decoding the TLC39 symbology.

remarks.para: Support for symbologies and their attributes depends on the imager/scanner and associated firmware installed in your Intermec computer, and on the current symbology settings as configured by the Intermec Settings application. For more information, see the Intermec Settings Command Reference Manual.
This class requires IVA version 5.01.40.1685 on the Intermec computer and is not supported by EV12.

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CTlc39.Enable
member.summary: Enables decoding of TLC39.
member.remarks: To enable TLC39, you must also enable MicroPDF417 and Code 39. When TLC39 is enabled, extended range on Code 39 is not available.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class BarcodeReader Private WithEvents bcr As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader
Private Sub BarcodeReader_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try bcr = New Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader() bcr.Symbology.Tlc39.Enable = CSymbology.CTlc39.EEnable.Enable Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CTlc39.LinearOnlyXmitMode
member.summary: Enables TLC39 linear-only transmission mode
member.remarks: In this mode, only data from the Code 39 label is transmitted. MicroPDF417 data is ignored.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class BarcodeReader Private WithEvents bcr As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader
Private Sub BarcodeReader_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try bcr = New Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader() bcr.Symbology.Tlc39.LinearOnlyXmitMode = CSymbology.CTlc39.ELinearOnlyXmitMode.Enable Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CTlc39.EciSecurity
member.summary: Specifies security level. Security is triggered when a TLC39 bar code is read if ECI has been found and Code 39 is enabled. If code is 6 digit, the scanner attempts to decode a TLC39 ECI part with more security.
member.remarks: Range is 0 to 100. The higher the value, the more secure the decode, but decoding becomes less snappy.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class BarcodeReader Private WithEvents bcr As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader
Private Sub BarcodeReader_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try bcr = New Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader() bcr.Symbology.Tlc39.EciSecurity = 50 Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CGs1Composite.EEanUpcCompMsgDecode
member.summary: An enum data type for the property.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CGs1Composite.EEanUpcCompMsgDecode.NeverLinked
member.summary: EAN/UPC bar code is not linked to the 2D composite component - only the EAN/UPC bar code is transmitted.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CGs1Composite.EEanUpcCompMsgDecode.AlwaysLinked
member.summary: EAN/UPC bar code is always linked to the 2D composite component. Both the EAN/UPC bar code and the 2D composite component are transmitted. If a 2D composite component is not present, the UPC bar code is not transmitted.

member.name: F:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CGs1Composite.EEanUpcCompMsgDecode.Autodiscriminate
member.summary: (Intermec computers with imagers only) The imager detects if there is a 2D composite component or not and then transmits the data accordingly. This option allows the imager to send EAN/UPC bar codes only or both the EAN/UPC bar code with the 2D composite component if present.

member.value: One ASCII character, or one non-printable ASCII character (such as "\x12").
member.remarks: If you set a string of length 0, getting this property returns \x0. The non-printable ASCII character is not displayed with the get property.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class BarcodeReader Private WithEvents bcr As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader
Private Sub BarcodeReader_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try bcr = New Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader() bcr.Symbology.HanXin.CodeMark = "*" Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: P:Intermec.DataCollection2.CSymbology.CHanXin.UserDefinedSymbologyId
member.summary: String specifying a user-defined symbology ID if not using the AIM standard. The UDSI is transmitted in the format [UDSI]<data>.
member.remarks: String is 0 to 4 ASCII characters long. Default user-defined symbology ID is P8. If there is no value specified, and symbology ID transmission is active, no symbology ID is sent for this symbology only.
member.exception: throws an exception when an error has occurred on methods and properties.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class BarcodeReader Private WithEvents bcr As Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader
Private Sub BarcodeReader_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Try bcr = New Intermec.DataCollection2.BarcodeReader() bcr.Symbology.HanXin.UserDefinedSymbologyId = "C2" Catch bcrexp As BarcodeReaderException MessageBox.Show(bcrexp.Message) End Try End Sub End Class

The DocumentCaptureEventArgs class passes this information to the event:
the path of the captured document file.

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection2.ErrorEventArgs
member.summary: Use this class for notification of file space or file save errors and image capture errors.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class Form1 Private WithEvents imgCapture As Intermec.DataCollection2.ImagerCapture
Private Sub Form1_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load imgCapture = New ImagerCapture("Camera") End Sub
Private Sub imgCapture_Error(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal CaptureErrorArgs As Intermec.DataCollection2.ErrorEventArgs) Handles imgCapture.Error If (CaptureErrorArgs.FileSaveError) Then txtStatus.Text = "Failed on save file = " + CaptureErrorArgs.ErrorMessage End If
If (CaptureErrorArgs.LimitStorageWarning) Then txtStatus.Text = "LimitWarning = " + CaptureErrorArgs.ErrorMessage End If
If (CaptureErrorArgs.ExceedStorageLimit) Then txtStatus.Text = "ExceedStorateError = " + CaptureErrorArgs.ErrorMessage End If
If (CaptureErrorArgs.ImageConditioningError) Then txtStatus.Text = "Image conditioning error = " + CaptureErrorArgs.ErrorMessage End If
If (CaptureErrorArgs.CaptureError) Then txtStatus.Text = "CaptureError = " + CaptureErrorArgs.ErrorMessage End If End Sub End Class

member.name: M:Intermec.DataCollection2.ErrorEventArgs.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Stores error information.
member.param: Saving an image file exceeded the memory limit. Subsequent attempts to save an image may fail due to the storage memory limit.
File exceeds the storage memory limit. A document image was captured but discarded.
The document capture interface is closed.
An unexpected error has occurred in the document capture interface.
An unrecoverable error has occurred in the document capture interface. The interface is closed and no document has been captured.
The image file cannot be created, possibly because the file size is too long, there is a file name conflict, or because old files cannot be deleted.
The capture process encountered an error and has been terminated.
The pictureBox failed to load image
String that describes errors.

member.name: T:Intermec.DataCollection2.GuidanceEventArgs
member.summary: The GuidanceEventArgs class passes image capture failure information to the Guidance event, such as when the document is too far away or at too sharp of an angle, when the focus check fails, or in the case of an internal error.

example.code:
Imports Intermec.DataCollection2 Public Class Form1 Private WithEvents imgCapture As Intermec.DataCollection2.ImagerCapture
Private Sub Form1_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load imgCapture = New ImagerCapture("Camera") End Sub
Private Sub imgCapture_Guidance(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal CaptureGuidanceArgs As Intermec.DataCollection2.GuidanceEventArgs) Handles imgCapture.Guidance If (CaptureGuidanceArgs.FocusCheckFailure) Then txtStatus.Text = "focus failure" End If
If (CaptureGuidanceArgs.ImagerFar) Then txtStatus.Text = "imager far" End If
If (CaptureGuidanceArgs.ImagerSharp) Then txtStatus.Text = "imager sharp" End If End Sub End Class

summary.para: Common helper class for setting properties and filters for images created by Intermec imagers.
Properties of this class configure image conditioning settings, which apply digital processing to images generated by the and classes.

remarks.para: This class is instantiated when you create an instance of the ImagerCapture class.
